author: David Hodari
title: Gold Maintains Post-Fed Gains as Rate Worries Fade
text:
Gold prices climbed for the second straight session Thursday, as the Federal Reserve sticking to its projections for three total interest-rate increases this year comforted some traders worried about higher rates.
Gold for April delivery climbed 0.8%, to $1,331.50 a troy ounce, on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have traded between about $1,305 and $1,360 this year, swinging within that range based on moves in the dollar and interest-rate expectations.
